column1: A **Unit Manager** is someone who *provides guidance, instruction, direction and* *leadership* *to a group* of other individuals (the team) for the purpose of achieving a key result or group of aligned results. The team leader reports to a manager (overseeing several teams). The team leader monitors the quantitative and qualitative result that is to be achieved. The Unit Manager often works within the team, as a member, carrying out the same roles but with the additional 'leader' responsibilities - as opposed to higher level management who often have a separate job role altogether. In order for a team to function successfully, the team leader must also motivate the team to ""use their knowledge and skills to achieve the shared goals."" When a Unit Manager motivates a team, group members can function in a goal oriented manner. A Unit Manager is also someone who has the capability to drive performance within a group of people. Team leaders utilize their expertise, their peers, influence, and/or creativeness to formulate an effective team.

A Unit Manager ensures continuity of care to residents by promoting and delivering high standards of care, individually and safely, and supporting, demonstrating and instructing less experienced staff to enable them to fully contribute to the care team.
Provides support and encouragement to resident’s in all areas/activities of daily living
Ensures the respect, dignity and rights to privacy of service users as far as possible
Contributes to the assessment of resident’s needs and the development of individualised plans of care and support, in consultation with resident’s, their relatives and the Care Team
Conducts risk assessments with due regards to resident’s, Visitors and Staff
Acts as a key worker for an identified resident, or designated group
Works with the care and support team to deliver high standards of service to achieve planned goals
Undertakes supervisory tasks as required: coaches and supports less experienced staff and assists with the induction and orientation of new staff.
